result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon J Bucher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with Count 8 and with 16CF28.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall seek and obtain full time employment.
Defendant shall not possess any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.

Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall possess prescriptions only with a valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed by his physician.
Defendant shall obtain all prescriptions from 1 pharmacy.
Defendant shall report any changes to medical appointments/medications to his Agent within 72 hours.
Credit for 106 days, if probation is revoked.

16 CF 13 Ct #8 and 16 CF 28 Ct #1 - 4 years WI State Prison - 2 years IC and 2 years ES - imposed & stayed - all concurrent.
16 CF 13 Ct #7 and 16 CF 28 Ct. #5 - 9 months co jail - imposed & stayed - concurrent w/ each other and concurrent with prison sentence.
Probation - 4 years on Ct. #8 in 16 CF 13 and on Ct. #1 in 16 CF 28 - concurrent
Probation - 1 year on Ct. #7 in 16 CF 13 and on Ct. #5 in 16 CF 28 - concurrent
Conditions:
1.  pay costs of the action.
2.  pay restitution - 16 CF 28 - $6510.00 and 16 CF 13 - $714.11.
3.  pay 10% restitution surcharge applicable to each case.
4.  participate in any assessments directed by his Agent and follow treatment recommendations arising therefrom.
5.  def. to not possess any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
6.  def. to possess prescriptions only w/ a valid prescription and take in manner & method as prescribed by his physician.
7.  def. to obtain all prescriptions from 1 pharmacy.
8.  def. to report any changes to medical appointments/medications to his Agent w/in 72 hours.
9.  def. to seek & obtain full-time employment.
10.  Ct. #8 - 16 CF 13 - serve 90 days co jail - sentence commences forthwith w/WR privileges.
11.  Ct. #1 - 16 CF 28 - serve 6 months co jail - imposed & stayed - may be utilized by his Agent upon application to the court.
16 CF 13 - 106 days credit, if revoked.
16 CF 28 - 99 days credit, if revoked.
